properties.name: CidrBlock
properties.description: The primary IPv4 CIDR block for the VPC.

type.description: The primary IPv4 CIDR block for the VPC.

properties.name: EnableDnsHostnames
properties.description: Indicates whether the instances launched in the VPC get DNS hostnames. If enabled, instances in the VPC get DNS hostnames; otherwise, they do not. Disabled by default for nondefault VPCs.

type.description: Indicates whether the instances launched in the VPC get DNS hostnames. If enabled, instances in the VPC get DNS hostnames; otherwise, they do not. Disabled by default for nondefault VPCs.

properties.name: EnableDnsSupport
properties.description: Indicates whether the DNS resolution is supported for the VPC. If enabled, queries to the Amazon provided DNS server at the 169.254.169.253 IP address, or the reserved IP address at the base of the VPC network range "plus two" succeed. If disabled, the Amazon provided DNS service in the VPC that resolves public DNS hostnames to IP addresses is not enabled. Enabled by default.

type.description: Indicates whether the DNS resolution is supported for the VPC. If enabled, queries to the Amazon provided DNS server at the 169.254.169.253 IP address, or the reserved IP address at the base of the VPC network range "plus two" succeed. If disabled, the Amazon provided DNS service in the VPC that resolves public DNS hostnames to IP addresses is not enabled. Enabled by default.

properties.name: InstanceTenancy
properties.description:
The allowed tenancy of instances launched into the VPC.

"default": An instance launched into the VPC runs on shared hardware by default, unless you explicitly specify a different tenancy during instance launch.

"dedicated": An instance launched into the VPC is a Dedicated Instance by default, unless you explicitly specify a tenancy of host during instance launch. You cannot specify a tenancy of default during instance launch.

Updating InstanceTenancy requires no replacement only if you are updating its value from "dedicated" to "default". Updating InstanceTenancy from "default" to "dedicated" requires replacement.

type.description:
The allowed tenancy of instances launched into the VPC.

"default": An instance launched into the VPC runs on shared hardware by default, unless you explicitly specify a different tenancy during instance launch.

"dedicated": An instance launched into the VPC is a Dedicated Instance by default, unless you explicitly specify a tenancy of host during instance launch. You cannot specify a tenancy of default during instance launch.

Updating InstanceTenancy requires no replacement only if you are updating its value from "dedicated" to "default". Updating InstanceTenancy from "default" to "dedicated" requires replacement.

properties.name: Ipv4IpamPoolId
properties.description: The ID of an IPv4 IPAM pool you want to use for allocating this VPC's CIDR

type.description: The ID of an IPv4 IPAM pool you want to use for allocating this VPC's CIDR

properties.name: Ipv4NetmaskLength
properties.description: The netmask length of the IPv4 CIDR you want to allocate to this VPC from an Amazon VPC IP Address Manager (IPAM) pool

type.description: The netmask length of the IPv4 CIDR you want to allocate to this VPC from an Amazon VPC IP Address Manager (IPAM) pool

properties.name: CidrBlockAssociations
properties.description: A list of IPv4 CIDR block association IDs for the VPC.

type.description: A list of IPv4 CIDR block association IDs for the VPC.

properties.name: DefaultNetworkAcl
properties.description: The default network ACL ID that is associated with the VPC.

type.description: The default network ACL ID that is associated with the VPC.

properties.name: DefaultSecurityGroup
properties.description: The default security group ID that is associated with the VPC.

type.description: The default security group ID that is associated with the VPC.

properties.name: Ipv6CidrBlocks
properties.description: A list of IPv6 CIDR blocks that are associated with the VPC.

type.description: A list of IPv6 CIDR blocks that are associated with the VPC.
